title: Fig Marmalade
summary: Rich, sweet marmalade made from ripe Cretan figs.

items: 2 lbs fresh figs, stemmed and quartered

instructions.value: Place figs in a large, heavy-bottomed pot with water and lemon juice.
Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce to a simmer. Cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add sugar and salt. Stir until sugar is completely dissolved.
Increase heat to medium-high and cook for 15-20 minutes, stirring frequently to prevent sticking.
The mixture will thicken and become glossy. For a smoother texture, mash some of the figs with a potato masher.
Stir in vanilla extract. Test consistency on a cold plate.
When ready, remove from heat and let cool for 5 minutes.
Pour into sterilized jars, leaving 1/4 inch headspace. Seal and process if desired.

tips_and_notes: Use ripe but firm figs for the best flavor and texture
Add a cinnamon stick or star anise while cooking for extra warmth
This marmalade is perfect with cheese and crackers
